data.product_title: Yaheetech 42 inch Double Door Dog Crate w/Divider for Puppy to Adult XL Collapsible Metal Crate with Removable Tray Wire Dog Kennel for Large Dogs Portable Travel Cage, Black
about_product: Versatile Dog Crate for All Stages: From playful puppies to adult dogs, this dog crate with divider adapts to every stage. Whether teaching your puppy good potty habits or helping them create a cozy, designated sleeping area, this adjustable divider helps tailor the space to ensure comfort and convenience

Portable & Collapsible Dog Crate: With its convenient buckle setup and a detachable handle, this 107 cm dog crate can be easily folded down to a compact size of 108.5 cm L × 61 cm W × 10 cm H. This dog cage is ideal for easy carrying during trips or camping and can be conveniently stored under your bed, sofa, or in tight spaces when not in use

Spacious Haven for Medium-Sized to Large Dogs: Tailored flawlessly for medium-sized to large dogs, this 42-inch pet cage is an ideal retreat for breeds like Labradors, Golden Retrievers, and Border Collies. Your furry friend will have plenty of room to lounge, stretch out, or chill comfortably in this cozy space

Pull-Out Leak-Proof Tray: This pet crate includes a pull-out leak-proof tray at the bottom to catch spills and accidents. The tray can be easily removed for cleaning, making maintaining a snap. The locking buckles keep the tray securely in place

Grow-with-Me Interior: This dog crate features a clever divider that adjusts the living space as your puppy grows. It’s not just a cozy home but a great assistant for enhancing potty training during those early days

product_information.Directions: With a foldable design with locking buckles and a handle for portability, it's ideal for journeys and outdoor adventures with your furry companion.

Is this dog crate WORTH IT!?

data.customers_say: Customers find the dog crate to be of good quality and appreciate its size, particularly noting it's suitable for Great Danes and growing puppies. The crate is easy to assemble and offers decent value for money. While some customers report sturdy construction, others find it isn't very sturdy, and the latches are difficult to open. The functionality receives positive feedback, with customers saying it works well for most dogs, including 30 lbs mini bernedoodles.

top_reviews.review_title: Easy to Set Up & Perfect for My Dog!
top_reviews.review_comment: I recently purchased the Yaheetech 36-inch Dog Crate for my puppy, and I’m really impressed! The setup was incredibly easy, which made the whole process so much smoother. The crate is sturdy, functional, and provides plenty of space for my dog to grow into. Pros: ✔️ Easy Assembly – I was able to set it up in just a few minutes—no tools required! ✔️ Durable & Well-Made – The metal construction feels strong, and the removable tray is super convenient for cleaning. ✔️ Double Doors – The two doors make it easier to access my dog from different angles, and they latch securely. ✔️ Divider for Puppies – The divider is a great feature, allowing me to adjust the space as my puppy grows. ✔️ Portable & Collapsible – The collapsible design makes it easy to store or travel with, which is a huge plus. Cons: ➖ Size – While the crate is perfect for small to medium dogs, it might be a bit tight for larger breeds. Final Thoughts: This dog crate is an excellent choice for puppies or small to medium dogs. It’s easy to set up, portable, and built to last. I love the divider and removable tray, which make it even more functional. Highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable, affordable dog crate!
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2025

top_reviews.review_comment: Easy to assemble, sturdy and roomy!
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2025

top_reviews.review_title: Dog Breeder Review: Fantastic crate, identical to more expensive ones
top_reviews.review_comment: I was hesitant to buy this crate because I saw some of the negative reviews and as a disabled person, I was worried that I would have trouble managing the latches, but it was on sale and then had a coupon and so my roommate and I both bought one of these crates. Both of the crates came in fantastic condition. They were in boxes that were dented so I was a bit worried but the crates were in perfect condition. The latches work smoothly, unlike one of the reviews stated. I have bought dozens of crates in the past because I breed a luxury type of golden retriever. With every puppy I sell I send a crate home with them. In fact I crate train my puppies before they leave. So as you can imagine getting crates inexpensively that are still quality is important to me. The picture is of a 4.5 month old golden retriever that I moved from a 30 inch crate where his head and his butt were touching both ends and he couldn’t sit up straight to this 42 inch crate which should last him for life. It’s gonna be a great size for him to grow into. His mom doesn’t even like crates and as soon as I set this up, she went inside of it before he did which was kind of funny. I realize that doesn’t really say anything about the crate but clearly she thought it was a good crate too. If you’re seeing little prongs on the top of it, that’s just the divider that I set on top of it. My dog is potty trained so there is no need for me to use it. One of the reviews complains that the dividers tips were metal. I have to tell you, out of all the crates I’ve bought in my lifetime I’ve never seen one where the divider tips weren’t metal. The secret to ensuring that your dog doesn’t fishhook their eyes or another part of their body on these is that once you put the dividers in you use pliers and you pinch them. This does mean that if you have to move the divider or take it out then you have to open it with the pliers again, but that’s the way to safely put them in. Also, I want to tell people about a little hack that you can do with these crates, which is awesome if you need a bigger crate or want to put two dogs in a crate you can remove one of the end panels by opening up the little hooks on the bottom and then you can zip tie two different crates together at the end. This makes one long crate and it’s something that I did for puppies as they were being crate trained, and were transitioning from being able to be together all the time to being alone in a crate. It works great. Doesn’t permanently damage the crate you just open the hook slightly push down on the side of the door. The door comes off. You do that on both crates. You remove the doors and store them somewhere safe and then later on you can put them back on and tighten the hooks back up with pliers and it doesn’t damage them. It doesn’t make them weak. I did see that some of the people that left reviews got this as a free item and man I wish I would’ve been here for that. But I don’t mind paying what I did for it and I wouldn’t mind paying a little bit more without the coupon. This is literally the exact same as the crate that I had him in before, just a different brand and actually the crate I had him before cost me just as much as this one did and was only 30 inches and came bent. Different brand entirely but this crate is exactly the same but did not come bent. This one fit better in the box it came in too. You won’t be disappointed in this crate.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2024

top_reviews.review_title: good if your on a budget or traveling
top_reviews.review_comment: it’s a good cage for the price! if you have a dog that will try to escape i would definitely look for something more sturdy.. we got this because it’s very easy to take down and put up for traveling. i was a little scared to purchase because i feel like nothing ever fits my 60lbs dog but he has plenty of room and i could see i dog up to 120lbs fitting in here. overall im very impressed and don’t regret buying.. both the doors are very sturdy and well made
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2025

top_reviews.review_comment: I have bought many of these! We rescue dogs and these are VERY well made and don’t rust. I love the double doors so that it is convenient to put in different parts of the room. The latches are good, but easy to open by my Husky who loves to let his friends out in the middle of the night to play. LOL.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2025

top_reviews.review_comment: Nice and sturdy, easy to assemble, perfect size, and delivered 3 days early!
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2025

top_reviews.review_comment: Great dog crate for small dogs. I wouldn't get it for a dog more than 8-10 pounds for sure. My dog is about 9 pounds and there is enough room for the dog bed to cover the whole bottom of the crate and he can stand a move around a little. If you want your dog to have more room to move around I would go with the next size up. I got the 24 inch. It is really well made just wish I had gone up one size, but it works for night time just fine.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2025

top_reviews.review_title: Very sturdy and easy to assemble
top_reviews.review_comment: I was very happy with this. It’s very sturdy. Easy to collapse and store. And easy to assemble. Exactly what I wanted and at a great price.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2025

top_reviews_global.review_title: Très bon choix facile à monter je le recommande fortement.

top_reviews_global.review_comment: Easy to set up and well made
Our 8 month old Shephard Cross pup has lots of room and it is so easy to clean when accidents happen. Easy to put together.
Great cage, easy to use. A bit heavy to carry, but easy to fold
